intro: Jacquemontia, commonly known as the "buttercup vine," is a genus of flowering plants in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, often yellow or orange flowers that resemble those of the buttercup. Jacquemontia species are typically herbaceous vines or shrubs, with opposite leaves and hairy stems. They are native to the Americas, ranging from North America to South America. Many species are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
